title: Small integral generators of totally complex number fields
abstract: Let $K$ be an algebraic number field and $H$ the absolute Weil height. Write $c_K$ for a certain positive constant that is an invariant of $K$. We consider the question: does $K$ contain an algebraic integer $α$ such that both $K = \mathbb{Q}(α)$ and $H(α) \le c_K$? If $K$ has a real embedding then a positive answer was established in previous work. Here we obtain a positive answer if $\textrm{Tor}\bigl(K^{\times}\bigr) \not= \{\pm 1\}$, and so $K$ has only complex embeddings. We also show that if the answer is negative, then $K$ is totally complex, $\textrm{Tor}\bigl(K^{\times}\bigr) = \{\pm 1\}$, and $K$ is a Galois extension of its maximal totally real subfield. Further, we show that if $μ\in O_K$ is not totally real, then there exists $α$ in $O_K$ with $K = \mathbb{Q}(α)$ and $H(α) \le H(μ)\thinspace c_K$.
comment: previously cited as "A note on small generators of number fields, II"
